terms.definition: Large Language Model - an AI system trained on vast amounts of text data to understand and generate human-like text, used for automating documentation tasks and powering chatbots
Technical documentation that explains how to use and integrate with an Application Programming Interface, including endpoints, parameters, and response formats
The practice of customizing a product or service with a client's branding and design while maintaining the original functionality
The systematic process of creating, organizing, storing, and sharing information and expertise within an organization
The process of adapting content, software, or documentation to meet the language, cultural, and regulatory requirements of specific regions or markets
Standard Operating Procedure - a detailed, written instruction document that describes the steps required to complete a specific task or process
Interactive help and instructional content embedded directly within a software application to guide users through features and processes
Compound Annual Growth Rate - a metric that measures the mean annual growth rate of an investment or market over a specified period
Comprehensive written materials that explain how to use, install, configure, or troubleshoot a product or service
A structured process that defines the steps and approvals required to publish or update documentation and software releases
The ability to customize and distribute documentation or services to multiple clients with different requirements and specifications
The practice of dividing content or users into distinct groups to deliver targeted and relevant information to each segment
Automatic synchronization of information that occurs immediately when changes are made to the source data or system
Point of Sale - a system used by businesses to process customer transactions and payments
The systematic process of identifying, diagnosing, and resolving problems or issues in software, hardware, or processes
